meanings.definition: To oversee or direct (an activity or process)
meanings.sent1: I superintend the school play rehearsals to make sure everything runs smoothly.
meanings.sent2: She superintends the construction site to ensure all safety protocols are followed.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to superintend the bird feeder, making sure no seeds go to waste.
meanings.sent4: As the captain of the ship, he superintends the crew like a vigilant guardian.
meanings.sent5: The teacher superintends the science experiment, guiding the students step by step.

meanings.definition: To be in charge of or manage (a place or organization)
meanings.sent1: My aunt will superintend the family reunion this year, organizing all the activities.
meanings.sent2: He superintends the company's finances, ensuring all budgets are met.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel decided to superintend the nut storage, arranging them by size.
meanings.sent4: The CEO superintends the entire corporation, steering it towards success.
meanings.sent5: The park ranger superintends the national park, protecting its wildlife and resources.
